title: 1988 Lamborghini Countach 5000 QV
description: This 1988 Lamborghini Countach is one of approximately 610 examples of the 5000 Quattrovalvole variant produced between 1985 and 1988. The US-market car was brought to Canada around 15 years ago and underwent a repaint in its current red finish by Lamborghini Montreal in 2020. It rides on gold-finished 15″ Ruote OZ wheels and features a European-specification front bumper and a V-shaped rear wing along with pop-up headlights and scissor doors. Inside, fixed-back bucket seats trimmed in Champagne leather are accompanied by a Raid steering wheel paired with a gated shifter as well as an Alpine AM/FM cassette stereo and air conditioning. Power is supplied by a 5.2-liter quad-cam V12 linked with a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Work completed in 2024 prior to the selling dealer's 2025 acquisition involved an engine-out service as well as installation of a replacement clutch assembly. Now showing 13k kilometers (~8k miles), this Countach 5000 QV is offered by the selling dealer with manufacturer's literature, a tool kit, partial service records, and Connecticut registration.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1988 Lamborghini Countach 5000 QV at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #184,651.

Further details include a European-specification front bumper as well as pop-up headlights, fog lights, and a V-shaped rear wing. Paint meter readings are shown in the gallery.

Gold-finished 15″ Ruote OZ wheels are mounted with 225/50 front and 345/35 rear Pirelli P Zero Asimmetrico tires. A Ruote OZ–branded spear with an older Michelin tire is stored in the front trunk. The Countach features a fully independent suspension with coil springs and telescopic shock absorbers, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated disc brakes.

The cockpit features fixed-back bucket seats upholstered in Champagne leather along with a matching center console, lower dashboard, and door panels. Interior appointments include an Alpine AM/FM cassette stereo and a Veglia digital clock along with air conditioning and manual-crank windows.

The leather-wrapped Raid steering wheel is paired with a dogleg-pattern gated shifter.
